description:
11.76 drawgraph
Draw a graph using input video metadata.

It accepts the following parameters:


Example using metadata from signalstats filter:

signalstats,drawgraph=lavfi.signalstats.YAVG:min=0:max=255

Example using metadata from ebur128 filter:

ebur128=metadata=1,adrawgraph=lavfi.r128.M:min=-120:max=5
name: drawgraph

options.description: Set 1st frame metadata key from which metadata values will be used to draw a graph.
options.name: m1

options.description: Set 2nd frame metadata key from which metadata values will be used to draw a graph.
options.name: m2

options.description: Set 3rd frame metadata key from which metadata values will be used to draw a graph.
options.name: m3

options.description: Set 4th frame metadata key from which metadata values will be used to draw a graph.
options.name: m4

options.description: Set graph background color. Default is white.
options.name: bg

options.description:
Set graph mode.

Available values for mode is:

‘bar’
‘dot’
‘line’

Default is line.
options.name: mode

options.description:
Set slide mode.

Available values for slide is:

‘frame’

Draw new frame when right border is reached.

‘replace’

Replace old columns with new ones.

‘scroll’

Scroll from right to left.

‘rscroll’

Scroll from left to right.

‘picture’

Draw single picture.

Default is frame.
options.name: slide

options.description: Set size of graph video. For the syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. The default value is 900x256.
options.name: size

options.description:
Set the output frame rate. Default value is 25.

The foreground color expressions can use the following variables:

MIN

Minimal value of metadata value.

MAX

Maximal value of metadata value.

VAL

Current metadata key value.

The color is defined as 0xAABBGGRR.
options.name: rate
